events.name: Universal Windows App on Windows 10 - June Meetup
events.description: The Topic and the Agenda will be announced later... Guest Speaker for the June Month Matteo Pagani, from Microsoft Will be a Skype Session with him at the Microsoft Level 22
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Last Wednesday Clojure Coders Meetup
events.description: This is the second meetup of the re-inaugurated Singapore Clojure Group. We are a very mixed bunch, from newbies to Clojure to language contributors. We are enthusiastic about learning and using Clojure and promoting it's use through sharing. • This meeting will have a code review session en group of an exercise set before hand as we feel that's one of the best ways to get to grips with Functional Programming and Clojure • Demos, community members can demo any projects, ideas etc they want to get feedback on.

events.name: Thursday 25th June
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along!

events.name: Mobile Growth Hackers at BASH with HotelQuickly, 99.co, + PicoCandy
events.description: We're excited to announce that our first Mobile Growth Hackers meetup in Singapore is June 25! Come meet other GrowthHackers, network, have some snacks and drinks, and get great insights on how to drive success for your mobile app. Our Meetup will be held at Block 79 JTC LaunchPad @ one-north. Hear from a panel of mobile growth experts as they take a deep dive into the strategies they used to grow their mobile apps. Panelists • Tomas Laboutka, CEO, HotelQuickly • Anuj Bheda, Co-founder, 99.co • Austin Hay, Partner Growth, Branch Metrics • Khang Toh, CTO and Co-founder, PicoCandy The panel will be moderated by Viren Shetty, Mobile Growth Hacker. The panel will run from 7pm to 8pm, with plenty of time for Q&A at the end. Before and after the panel, you'll have time to chat with your fellow GrowthHackers and enjoy pizza and drinks.

events.name: 2nd Bluemix SG Meetup: Building your mobile backend with Bluemix and SoftLayer
events.description: It's another meetup with Bluemix, and this month we're going to introduce how you can build your mobile backend with Bluemix. We've also teamed up with SoftLayer to tell you more about what MobileFirst Platform is, and how you can deploy your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer. In the spirit of our Bluemix meetups, we will focus on technical demos. Agenda: 7pm - 7.30pm: Registration + Pizza 7.30pm - 8.30pm: How to build your iOS or Android mobile backend with Bluemix 8.30pm - 9.30pm: Set up and Run your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer How to build your iOS or Android mobile backend with Bluemix Learn how to easily set up your mobile backend really quickly, with monitoring and logging capabilities, data synchronisation, push notifications, and much more. Set up and run your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer Learn how and why Mobile App developers run their MobileFirst environment + their iOS and Android Apps in production on SoftLayer. Gain Practical insights in a hands-on demo on how you can quickly and easily design and provision the IBM SoftLayer reference architecture for MobileFirst.

events.name: iOS Dev Scout June Meetup
events.description: Venue: Multi-purpose Room, 9th Floor, Suntec Tower Five, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five,[masked] Nearby MRT: Promenade, City Hall, Esplanade Speakers: 1st Speaker: Shubham Goyal 2nd Speaker: Mugunth Kumar Quick Talks: Akira Hirakawa Agenda: 7:00 PM: Shubham's topic is yet to be decided 7:45 PM: Mugunth will share what's new in iOS 9 SDK 8:30 PM: Show & Tell / Quick Talks - Akira to share about Swift Coding Style
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Mid-Year catch up
events.description: Dear friends, It's been a while since we last got together, and how better than to celebrate the mid-year over drinks to meet and greet your fellow DataKinders! Come say hi, and bond over food and drinks! It's pay your own way. We'll post a venue soon once we found a comfy bar where we can have a cozy chat. See you there!
events.location: FIV五 @ Great Eastern Centre, 1 Pickering Street 048659, Singapore

events.name: A peek into industrial 3D printing, and 3D scanning and printing
events.description: We will have an expert who will share insights on metal 3D printing with industrial technology! ....and what's a hacker meetup without cool hacks! Yes, we will try 3D scanning a pair of glasses and replicating it by 3D printing :))

events.name: Apple Watch pairing and user experience
events.description: To get members to share experience in using Apple watch with iPhone 5 and above.
events.location: TCC, POMO, 1 Selegie Road #01-02 & #02-25 PoMo, 188306, Singapore

events.name: WordPress Meetup (June 2015)
events.description: It's time for another meetup! The WordPress Singapore meetup aims to bring together people of all skill levels, from beginners to people who have been using WordPress since it was first released in 2003 (woah!). Programme: • "WordPress and Amazon Web Services" (topic tbc) by Chris Hampartsoumian • "Scaling Tech in Asia" by Lester Chan • "In Page SEO" by Suren Dias • Open space discussion We're looking for speakers and volunteers to help organise our meetups! Please contact Valentine or Jon if you're interested in helping out. Feel free to also RSVP on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/866475686753531/ Venue sponsor: Amazon Web Services (Thanks guys!) Address: Amazon Web Services Level 10 23 Church Street Capital Square Singapore[masked]
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10, 23 Church Street, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance Next week we'll be covering Chapter 9: Brief History of HTTP Reminder: Book club is taking two weeks break and will resume on Tuesday 30th June. Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Call for ideas e.g. DevOps current, future and the past - where is DevOps going?
events.description: Hey! Each meetup we have two 15 minutes slots available for talks. Short talks about what bothers / amazes / confuses you about DevOps and related topics are very welcome and a good way to ignite each other. Just add a comment below to propose a topic. Agenda 19:00 Start – grab some great food from the buffet and enjoy a drink with others 19:15 Talk 19:35 Break 19:50 Talk 20:05 Break 20:15 Talk / Fishbowl and Drinks 21:00 End Food and drinks will be served.

events.name: July Meetup - two talks
events.description: Dear Ingenious Haskellers, Welcome another great opportunity to share our passion. On July the 1st, we will have two speakers: "Damas-Milner type system" - Paul Meng (shifted from June's meetup) "Homplexity - measuring Haskell code quality at large" - Michal J. Gajda http://github.com/mgajda/homplexity Please contact organizers if you want to talk! We are looking for new talks!

events.name: IBM | Spark Signature Moment Singapore Event
events.description: IBM is placing its biggest bet on open source innovation since we led the adoption of Linux through hundreds of business solutions. We are announcing our commitment to Apache Spark, an in-memory compute engine that delivers eye-opening speed and flexibility to data scientists and developers working with big data at scale. In fact, we are bringing the speed, agility and power of Spark into our Analytics Platform to make sure we're meeting the emerging needs of data-driven enterprises. After our initial launch we will be hosting a regional Spark Signature Moment Event in Singapore on Thursday July 2, 2015 Join Us for an Update & Lunch to Learn About IBM’s Commitment to Open Source & Spark Innovation Agenda: Reception and introductions by IBM regional Executive Highlights from IBM Signature Moment Round Table in San Francisco Presentation: o The use cases for Big Data platform and the benefits of Apache Spark o IBM’s innovations for Apache Spark, hybrid architecture o Open Data Platform (ODP) o IBM’s Analytics Platform for Apache Spark Lunch Check us out at: ibm.co/ibmspark RSVP by June 25th – LIMITED SEATING
events.location: IBM Client Centre, No.6 Tampines Industrial Ave 5 ,Singaore 528760, Singapore

events.name: Hackathon@SG Bluemix Workshop (IOT, Mobile and SoftLayer)
events.description: IBM Bluemix is a Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) that supports several programming languages and services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud. This session will cover the following: - Smart Nation intro by IDA - Overview of IBM Cloud (Bluemix/SL) - IBM IOT Foundation - Build Mobile App with Bluemix - SoftLayer and your hosting/computational requirements - Wrap up *Bring your own laptop Register here for your Bluemix account.
events.location: SMU School of Economics, Seminar Room 2.6, 90 Stamford Road, 178903, Singapore

events.name: July/2015 - Open Space (Tools)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Farid Baharuddin from WPH Open Space Theme: Tools Farid: This can be tools to help development and management agile projects, how they are good or how in general they are bad, tools for "no-estimates", books or whatever helps us improve productivity or ourselves. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) . Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Someone from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he/she will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: Angular and JHipster night!
events.description: Hi, location is now confirmed. We will host our event at Paypal (Suntec tower). Michael Isvy - Migrating a JSP application to AngularJS Why are so many people moving to AngularJS? Is it a suitable choice for all Java applications? Does it add complexity to your project? Michael will walk you through a step by step migration from JSP to AngularJS. Deepu K Sasidharan - JHispter Deepu is one of the JHipster contributors and we are honored to have him at the Spring User Group. He will walk you through the JHipster core features, do a hands-on demo and will provide feedback on building a real enterprise application using JHipster.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Hack and Tell
events.description: Show and tell for hackers. Five minute demos, each followed by 5 minutes of Q&A.

events.name: Algorithm used in Games: Any Angle Path Finding in Open Space by @Oh Shun Hao
events.description: The answer to finding the shortest path between two points on a graph is well-known. However, strategy games and other real-life cases often involve wide-open spaces without well-defined graphs, how does one construct shortest paths between arbitrary points in a space? We give an overview of the most effective algorithms for generating realistic paths using a grid-based approximation of open spaces. Oh Shunhao is a Computer Science and Mathematics student at NUS. He enjoys mathematical problems and algorithms, and loves sharing about them with like-minded people. He also makes games in his spare time. He is currently working with Health Visuals to produce a game for the app store. His current research work involves working on finding fast any-angle pathfinding algorithms for use in games, as well as developing cool visualisations for them.

events.description: We are having a Web Application hacking event this coming 4th June 2015 (Saturday), 12noon Eastern Standard Time over at HackrGround.com

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm 2015:time:space: By Robert Casteels, Dirk Stromberg and Andrew Thomas 7.30pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 2015:time:space: is a collaborative work of voices, electronic instruments, live processing, tape and video. New electronic instruments are altered in real time, fusing effortlessly with the human voice. Projected against this kaleidoscope of sound will be stunning pre-recorded images of Singapore, tying in sounds from humanity to the technology of our modern world, crossing time and space. Original production generously supported by the National Arts Council. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.

events.name: Maker Faire Singapore
events.description: Maker Faire Singapore is back for the 4th year! And this time we are featured, thanks to the enthusiastic support from the Maker Community in Singapore!

events.name: AWS First Tuesday - July Meet up
events.description: I'm pleased to announce that we will be holding our next AWS User Group meetup here in the AWS Singapore office on Tuesday 14th July. Despite the name being 'First Tuesday', this meetup will actually be on the second Tuesday in July (which is 14th July). Expect a similar format to the last couple of meetups, we will be hosting here in the AWS Singapore office again, kicking off at 7pm, Pizza and refreshments will be served. Talks will begin at 7.30pm and run for about 80 minutes. We aim to keep them short at no more than 20 minutes each. WHAT: 7.00 pm - Pizza and refreshments 7.30 pm - Chris Hampartsoumian, AWS Welcome. I will be publishing the talk titles and schedule on this page closer to the event, but we've got plenty in store - but potentially still some open slots of you'd like to present at this User Group meetup or any future event. Do get in contact with me, Chris Hampartsoumian. We're looking forward to seeing you at the meetup! WHERE: The AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their organization. • Startup founders and aspiring founders COST: Free! Snacks will be served!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.name: talk.js
events.description: The next talk.js will be on Tuesday July 14th. We have moved our venue back to Microsoft. Scheduled Talks: • Parsing JavaScript with JavaScript Parsers - Joshua Koo • Meet the EdgeHTML - Riza Marhaban • Chorustext Assistive Device - David Effendi Location: Microsoft Singapore One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989 Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Data Mining With R (Workshop II)
events.description: Hello everyone, here are the details for our second workshop on data mining. It will be on Random Forests, and our speaker will be Toh Wei Zhong. About : Random Forests are built up from classification / regression trees. By randomly selecting predictors and creating an ensemble of trees (i.e. the forest), we are able to greatly increase the predictive capability of the method. In this talk, Wei Zhong will go into the details of the methodology, starting with the terminology all the way up to tuning the hyperparameters. We will end the workshop with a code walkthrough. About Wei Zhong: Wei Zhong is a graduate from the computational biology department at NUS. An ardent R user, he currently works as a data scientist at NCS. Slides are available at on github in the random_forest folder: https://github.com/singator/rugs
events.location: NTUC Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard, No 1, Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #011
events.description: Paper #1: On computable numbers, with an application to the Entscheidungsproblem : Melvin Zhang - http://www.cs.virginia.edu/~robins/Turing_Paper_1936.pdf Paper #2: Oberon System Implemented on a Low-Cost FPGA Board : Michał - http://www.xilinx.com/publications/archives/xcell/Xcell91.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: Dynatrace Personal License Test Drive
events.description: Take the most trusted APM for a test drive. Only 3 steps to analyze the performance of your application performance and get: - Transaction Flow PurePath from device and database - User insight on how application performance impacts your end users, software adoption and business success - Diagnose root causes down to the method level
events.location: The Co, 75 High Street  Singapore , 179435 Singapore

events.name: A look at IP issues arising from 3D printing
events.description: Did you know what implications you would face when downloading a 3D model to print? Come hear from a practicing IP lawyer and join us for a day of 3D printing, scanning, and networking over food. Cheers.

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
